bugs.title: CVE-2020-27814 openjpeg2: openjpeg: Heap-buffer-overflow in lib/openjp2/mqc.c could result in DoS [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-27814 openjpeg2: openjpeg: Heap-buffer-overflow in lib/openjp2/mqc.c could result in DoS [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-27814 openjpeg: heap-buffer-overflow in lib/openjp2/mqc.c could result in DoS

long_desc.thetext:
A heap-buffer overwrites error was discovered in lib/openjp2/mqc.c in
OpenJPEG 2.3.1. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may
lead to remote denial of service or possibly remote code execution.

Created mingw-openjpeg2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1902001]


Created openjpeg2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1901999]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1902000]

Acknowledgments:

Name: zodf0055980 (SQLab NCTU Taiwan)

External References:

https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/issues/1283

Upstream patches:

https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/commit/15cf3d95814dc931ca0ecb132f81cb152e051bae
https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/commit/eaa098b59b346cb88e4d10d505061f669d7134fc

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2020-27814

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4251 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4251

bugs.title: CVE-2020-27824 openjpeg2: openjpeg: global-buffer-overflow read in lib-openjp2 [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-27824 openjpeg2: openjpeg: global-buffer-overflow read in lib-openjp2 [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-27824 openjpeg: global-buffer-overflow read in opj_dwt_calc_explicit_stepsizes()

long_desc.thetext:
In openjpeg v2.3.1 and prior, if too many decomposition levels are supplied to the encoder, it could cause a global buffer overflow to out-of-bounds read in the opj_dwt_calc_explicit_stepsizes() function.

Reference: https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/issues/1286
Upstream patch: https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/pull/1292/commits/6daf5f3e1ec6eff03b7982889874a3de6617db8d

Created openjpeg tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1905724]


Created openjpeg2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1905726]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1905725]

Acknowledgments:

Name: zodf0055980 (SQLab NCTU Taiwan)

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4251 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4251

bugs.title: CVE-2020-27823 openjpeg2: openjpeg: Heap-buffer-overflow write in lib-openjp2 [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-27823 openjpeg2: openjpeg: Heap-buffer-overflow write in lib-openjp2 [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-27823 openjpeg: heap-buffer-overflow write in opj_tcd_dc_level_shift_encode()

long_desc.thetext:
In openjpeg v2.3.1 and prior, there's a heap buffer overflow in opj_tcd_dc_level_shift_encode() causing an out-of-bounds WRITE when crafted input is processed by the encoder and -d option is used.

Reference: https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/issues/1284
Upstream patch: https://github.com/uclouvain/openjpeg/commit/b2072402b7e14d22bba6fb8cde2a1e9996e9a919

Acknowledgments:

Name: zodf0055980 (SQLab NCTU Taiwan)

Statement:

Red Hat Product Security has rated this flaw with Moderate severity because it affects the encoder functionality specifically when performing an image conversion and not general reading of image files.

Mitigation:

This flaw can be mitigated by not using openjpeg to convert untrusted image files.

Created openjpeg tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1906221]


Created openjpeg2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1906219]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1906220]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4251 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4251
